Japanese:
このあたりの建物を、
全部どこか遠くに
運んで！！
English: Please move all of the buildings on this side to some place far away from here!!

Japanese:
何もない中に、この店だけ
ポツンと建ってるのが理想なの！
English: If our store is the only thing left standing the middle of nothing, it'd be ideal!

Japanese:
やっぱり、売り上げは
かんばしくないってわけか？
English: Is the store's profit still no good after all?

Japanese: うまくいかないもんだな。
English: Well, I guess there was no way it was going to go so smoothly.

Japanese:
いっそ、このあたりの建物を、
全部どこか遠くに
運んでくれないかな？
English: Couldn't you move all of the buildings nearby to somewhere far away?

Japanese:
何もない中に、この店だけ
ポツンと建ってれば、
イヤでも目立つし……。
English: If there was nothing but the store stood all by itself, it'd really stand out...

Japanese:
いくらなんでも
やりすぎだって！
English: You're asking for way too much!

Japanese:
オートマンが暴れたせいで、
そうなることは
あるかもしれないけど。
English: If there were Automen on the rampage, we might have been able to do it.

Japanese:
都合よくオートマンが
来るはずないしな。
English: But, I don't think the Automen are just going to show up that convienently.
